sen.j: 往来物（おうらいもの）とは、平安時代後期より、明治時代初頭にかけて主に書簡などの手紙類の形式をとって作成された初等教育用の教科書の総称である。
sen.e: Oraimono is a collective term for primary education text books that were compiled from the late Heian period to the early Meiji period, mainly in the form of letters.
Oraimono is a collective term for primary education text books that were compiled from the late Heian period to the early Meiji period, mainly in the form of letters.
Oraimono is a collective term for primary education text books that were compiled from the late Heian period to the early Meiji period, mainly in the form of letters.

sen.j: 平安時代後期より公家などの文筆に携わる人々が往復書簡（往来）の形式を採った文例集（消息集）に由来している（同じ様な形式のものは、中国伝来とされる『杜家立成』が東大寺正倉院に収められているが、当時の中国の書式を元により整理された形式となっており、往来物が中国のものの影響を受けながらも日本独自に発展していったことが分かる）。
sen.e: They derived from boilerplates (shosoku-shu) which were a collection of correspondence from the late Heian period written by those who were engaged in literary work, such as nobles (A similar item called "Tokarissei", reportedly from China, is preserved in Todai-ji Temple Shosoin, but even this had been arranged from the Chinese original, showing that oraimono developed independently with an influence from China).

They derived from boilerplates (shosoku-shu) which were a collection of correspondence from the late Heian period written by those who were engaged in literary work, such as nobles (A similar item called "Tokarissei", reportedly from China, is preserved in Todai-ji Temple Shosoin, but even this had been arranged from the Chinese original, showing that oraimono developed independently with an influence from China).

They derived from boilerplates (shosoku-shu) which were a collection of correspondence from the late Heian period written by those who were engaged in literary work, such as nobles (A similar item called "Tokarissei," reportedly from China, is preserved in Todai-ji Temple Shoso-in Treasure Repository, but even this had been arranged from the Chinese original, showing that oraimono developed independently with an influence from China).
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を移動、Shosoin→Shoso-in Treasure Repositoryとしました。

sen.j: だが、後世に入ると武士や商人・農民など身分それぞれの必要に合わせた知識や慣習を盛り込んだものや習字用の｢字尽し｣など書簡形式をとらないものが著された。
sen.e: In later years, some oraimono were composed of knowledge and customs necessary for each social status, such as samurai, merchants and farmers, while 'Jizukushi', which were not in the form of correspondence, were compiled for calligraphy practice.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In later years, some oraimono were composed of knowledge and customs necessary for each social status, such as samurai, merchants and farmers, while 'Jizukushi', which were not in the form of correspondence, were compiled for calligraphy practice.

In later years, some oraimono were composed of knowledge and customs necessary for each social status, such as samurai, merchants and farmers, while 'Jizukushi,' which were not in the form of correspondence, were compiled for calligraphy practice.

sen.j: また、地理や歴史、道徳的な要素を盛り込んだものなど、多彩な形式の往来物が著された。
sen.e: Also, there were those that included elements of geography, history and morals, meaning that various forms of oraimono were written.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, there were those that included elements of geography, history, and morals, meaning that various forms of oraimono were written.
Also, there were those that included elements of geography, history, and morals, meaning that various forms of oraimono were written.

sen.j: 江戸時代には寺子屋などの教材として様々な往来物が執筆された。
sen.e: In the Edo period, all kinds of oraimono were made for text books at terakoya (temple elementary school during the Edo period),
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the Edo period, all kinds of oraimono were made for text books at terakoya (temple elementary school during the Edo period),
In the Edo period, all kinds of oraimono were made for text books at terakoya (temple elementary school during the Edo period),

sen.j: 特に寺子屋の教師の中に自前の往来物を著す者が多かった事からその総数を把握する事が不可能に近いが、現存するものは約7,000種と言われている。
sen.e: It is almost impossible to have a grasp of the total number of oraimono as, in particular, many terakoya teachers tried to write their own oraimono, but existing ones are said to be about 7,000 kinds.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is almost impossible to have a grasp of the total number of oraimono as, in particular, many terakoya teachers tried to write their own oraimono, but existing ones are said to number about 7,000 kinds.

It is almost impossible to have a grasp of the total number of oraimono as, in particular, many terakoya teachers tried to write their own oraimono, but existing ones are said to number about 7,000 kinds.

sen.j: 現存する最古のものは、文章博士や大学頭を務めた平安時代末期の学者・藤原明衡のものとされる『明衡往来』（『雲州往来』・『雲州消息』とも）と言われており、月ごとにその月にまつわる行事などの文例をまとめた12ヶ月分によって構成されている。
sen.e: The oldest existing oraimono, "Meigo Orai (Meigo's Correspondence)," is believed to have been written by FUJIWARA no Akihira, a scholar in the late Heian period who served as Monjo hakase (professor of literature) and Daigaku no kami (Director of the Bureau of Education) (This book is also called "Unshu Orai" or "Unshu Shosoku" and it is comprised of 12 months' worth of example sentences which are related to events of each month).

The oldest existing oraimono, "Meigo Orai (Meigo's Correspondence)," is believed to have been written by FUJIWARA no Akihira, a scholar in the late Heian period who served as Monjo hakase (professor of literature) and Daigaku no kami (Director of the Bureau of Education) (This book is also called "Unshu Orai" or "Unshu Shosoku" and is comprised of 12 months' worth of example sentences which are related to events of the respective months).

The oldest existing oraimono, "Meigo Orai" (Meigo's Correspondence), is believed to have been written by FUJIWARA no Akihira, a scholar in the late Heian period who served as Monjo hakase (professor of literature) and Daigaku no kami (Director of the Bureau of Education) (This book is also called "Unshu Orai" or "Unshu Shosoku" and is comprised of 12 months' worth of example sentences which are related to events of the respective months).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動

sen.j: これとほぼ同時代の作品と言われているものに『高山寺本古往来』・『季綱往来』・『東山往来』・『和泉往来』などがある。
sen.e: The books that are said to be from around this time are "Kozanjibon Koorai (Kozan-ji Temple Correspondence)," "Kiko Orai (Kiko's Correspondence)," "Tozan Orai" (also called "Higashiyama Orai") and "Kasen Orai" (also called "Izumi Orai"), etc.

The books that are said to be from around this time are "Kozanjibon Koorai (Kozan-ji Temple Correspondence)," "Kiko Orai (Kiko's Correspondence)," "Tozan Orai" (also called "Higashiyama Orai"), "Kasen Orai" (also called "Izumi Orai"), etc.

The books that are said to be from around this time are "Kozanjibon Koorai" (Kozan-ji Temple Correspondence), "Kiko Orai" (Kiko's Correspondence), "Tozan Orai" (also called "Higashiyama Orai"), "Kasen Orai" (also called "Izumi Orai"), etc.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には毎月2通分の往復書簡で季節感や行事を織り込んだ『十二月往来』が著され、後世の往来物の手本となった。
sen.e: "Junigetsu Orai (Twelve Months Correspondence)", which took the form of two letters a month describing the turning of the seasons as well as seasonal events, was composed in the Kamakura period and became a good example for oraimono that followed.

"Junigetsu Orai (Twelve Months Correspondence)", which took the form of two letters per month describing the turning of the seasons as well as seasonal events, was composed in the Kamakura period and became a good example for oraimono that followed.

"Junigetsu Orai" (Twelve Months Correspondence), which took the form of two letters per month describing the turning of the seasons as well as seasonal events, was composed in the Kamakura period and became a good example for oraimono that followed.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動

sen.j: その後室町時代前期にかけて『貴嶺問答』・『雑筆往来』、そして中世往来物の代表作とされる『庭訓往来』が現れた。
sen.e: Then, by the early Muromachi period, "Kirei Mondo," "Zohitsu Orai" (also called "Zappitsu Orai") and "Teikin Orai (a collection of letters used for family education)," which is considered to be the most important work of oraimono from the medieval time, were all written.

Then, by the early Muromachi period, "Kirei Mondo," "Zohitsu Orai" (also called "Zappitsu Orai") and "Teikin Orai (a collection of letters used for family education)," which is considered to be the most important work of oraimono from the medieval time, were all written.

Then, by the early Muromachi period, "Kirei Mondo," "Zohitsu Orai" (also called "Zappitsu Orai") and "Teikin Orai" (a collection of letters used for family education), which is considered to be the most important work of oraimono from the medieval time, were all written.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動

sen.j: 当時の武家社会の実情に即してかつ簡明ながらも生活に必要な実用的知識を網羅的に収録したこの本は江戸時代まで往来物の定番とされた。
sen.e: As "Teikin Orai" covers and plainly explains the practical knowledge necessary for life in samurai society of the time, this text book had been a standard oraimono until the Edo period.
As "Teikin Orai" covers and plainly explains the practical knowledge necessary for life in samurai society of the time, this text book served as a standard oraimono until the Edo period.
As "Teikin Orai" covers and plainly explains the practical knowledge necessary for life in samurai society of the time, this text book served as a standard oraimono until the Edo period.

sen.j: 続いて物語的色彩の強い『富士野往来』や類聚形式の『尺素往来』などが出された。
sen.e: Then came "Fujino Orai" with more narrative tone, and "Sekiso Orai" which took a style of assembling similar kinds of items.
Then came "Fujino Orai" with more narrative tone, and "Sekiso Orai," which took a style of assembling similar kinds of items.
Then came "Fujino Orai" with more narrative tone, and "Sekiso Orai," which took a style of assembling similar kinds of items.

sen.j: この時代までの往来物は公家や僧侶などの知識人によって書かれる事が多く、こうした江戸時代以前の作品をまとめて「古往来（こおうらい）」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Oraimono by this period of history were mainly written by the educated classes, such as nobles and Buddhist priests so that the oraimono before the Edo period are collectively called 'Koorai' (literally, old oraimono).

Oraimono by this period of history were mainly written by the educated classes, such as nobles and Buddhist priests, and therefore the oraimono before the Edo period are collectively called 'Koorai' (literally, old oraimono).

Oraimono by this period of history were mainly written by the educated classes, such as nobles and Buddhist priests, and therefore the oraimono before the Edo period are collectively called 'Koorai' (literally, old oraimono).

sen.j: 古往来は現存するもので約40余りを数えるが、以下の5種類に分類する事が出来る。
sen.e: There are around 40 existing koorai and they can be categorized in the following 5 groups.
There are around 40 existing koorai, and they can be categorized in the following 5 groups.
There are around 40 existing koorai, and they can be categorized in the following five groups.

sen.j: 『明衡往来』に代表される実際に用いられる形式の書簡を無造作に集めたもの。
sen.e: The first group of koorai includes books with letters, which are in forms of practical use, collected without any particular purpose, such as "Meigo Orai."
The first group of koorai includes books with letters, which are in forms of practical use, collected without any particular purpose, such as "Meigo Orai."
The first group of koorai includes books with letters, which are in forms of practical use, collected without any particular purpose, such as "Meigo Orai."

sen.j: 『十二月往来』に代表される1年12ヶ月の月単位に配列して書簡の文例を示したもの。
sen.e: The second group consists of those like "Junigetsu Orai," which have an assortment of example sentences for letters arranged according to the 12 months of a year.
The second group consists of those like "Junigetsu Orai," which have an assortment of example sentences for letters arranged according to the 12 months of the year.
The second group consists of those like "Junigetsu Orai," which have an assortment of example sentences for letters arranged according to the 12 months of the year.

sen.j: 『雑筆往来』に代表される書簡に用いられる語句・単文を列挙したもの。
sen.e: The third group is composed of volumes with a list of phrases and simple sentences for letters, with "Zohitsu Orai" being a typical example.
The third group is composed of volumes with a list of phrases and simple sentences for letters, with "Zohitsu Orai" being a typical example.
The third group is composed of volumes with a list of phrases and simple sentences for letters, with "Zohitsu Orai" being a typical example.

sen.j: 『庭訓往来』に代表される書簡形式を採った単語集・知識集で、書簡の形式とともに必要な知識を身に付けさせる事を目指したもの。
sen.e: The forth group represented by "Teikin Orai" comprises of books of words and knowledge in the style of letters, which aimed to spread necessary knowledge as well as the form of letters.
The fourth group represented by "Teikin Orai" comprises books of words and knowledge in the style of letters, which aimed to spread necessary knowledge as well as the form of letters.
The fourth group represented by "Teikin Orai" comprises books of words and knowledge in the style of letters, which aimed to spread necessary knowledge as well as the form of letters.

sen.j: 『富士野往来』に代表される書簡のみならず公文書などの他の文書の文例を織り交ぜたもの。
sen.e: The fifth group, which has "Fujino Orai" as an example, includes titles with sentences not only from letters but also from other documents such as official papers.
The fifth group, which has "Fujino Orai" as an example, includes titles with sentences not only from letters but also from other documents such as official papers.
The fifth group, which has "Fujino Orai" as an example, includes titles with sentences not only from letters but also from other documents such as official papers.

sen.j: 江戸時代に入ると、『庭訓往来』のような既成の往来物に加えて新たな往来物が目的に応じて著されるようになった。
sen.e: In the Edo period, on top of the then existing oraimono such as "Teikin Orai," new oraimono were introduced with different purposes.
In the Edo period, on top of the then existing oraimono such as "Teikin Orai," new oraimono were introduced with different purposes.
In the Edo period, on top of the then existing oraimono such as "Teikin Orai," new oraimono were introduced with different purposes.

sen.j: 農村向けのものとしては農事暦の要素を織り込んだ『田舎往来』・『農業往来』・『百姓往来』などが、都市の商人向けのものとしては『商売往来』・『問屋往来』・『呉服往来』・『万祥廻船往来』などが代表的な往来物としてあげられる。
sen.e: For farming villages, elements of the farming calendar were included in "Inaka Orai (A Letter on Farming Village) (also called "Densha Orai")," "Nogyo Orai" and "Hyakusho Orai (A Guide to Farming)," etc. while "A Guide to Commerce," "Toiya Orai (also called "Tonya Orai")," "Gofuku Orai" and "Banshokaisen Orai" and so on were the typical oraimono for merchants living in cities.

For farming villages, elements of the farming calendar were included in "Inaka Orai (A Letter on Farming Village) (also called "Densha Orai")," "Nogyo Orai" and "Hyakusho Orai (A Guide to Farming)," etc. while "A Guide to Commerce," "Toiya Orai (also called "Tonya Orai")," "Gofuku Orai" and "Banshokaisen Orai" and so on were the typical oraimono for merchants living in cities.

For farming villages, elements of the farming calendar were included in "Inaka Orai" (A Letter on Farming Village) (also called "Densha Orai"), "Nogyo Orai" and "Hyakusho Orai" (A Guide to Farming), etc. while "A Guide to Commerce," "Toiya Orai" (also called "Tonya Orai"), "Gofuku Orai" and "Banshokaisen Orai" and so on were the typical oraimono for merchants living in cities.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動

sen.j: 『富士野往来』に始まる歴史物語を織り込んだものは「武家往来」とも呼ばれ、十返舎一九が伝記型の往来物を確立し、更に史詩型の往来物へと発展した。
sen.e: Oraimono with historical episodes which started with "Fujino Orai" are called 'buke orai' (literally, samurai orai) and later developed into the historical poetry style oraimono, after Ikku JUPPENSHA established the biography style oraimono.

Oraimono with historical episodes which started with "Fujino Orai" are called 'buke orai' (literally, samurai orai) and later developed into the historical poetry style oraimono, after Ikku JUPPENSHA established the biography style oraimono.

Oraimono with historical episodes which started with "Fujino Orai" are called 'buke orai' (literally, samurai orai) and later developed into the historical poetry style oraimono, after Ikku JUPPENSHA established the biography style oraimono.

sen.j: また、子供達の関心を呼ぶために他地域の地理や風物・物産などを織り込んだ往来物も作られ、『日本国尽』・『都名所往来』・『浪花往来』・『中仙道往来』、そして明治維新期には『世界風俗往来』まで作成されるに至った。
sen.e: Furthermore, oraimono featuring geography, scenery and produce of other regions were written to interest children, which include " Nihonkunizukushi," "Miyakomeisho Orai (Correspondence on Sights in Miyako (present-day Kyoto))," "Naniwa Orai (Letters On Sights of Naniwa (present-day Osaka))" and "Nakasendo Orai", and in the period of the Meiji Restoration, "Sekaifuzoku Orai" was composed.

Furthermore, oraimono featuring geography, scenery, and produce of other regions were written to interest children, which include " Nihonkunizukushi," "Miyakomeisho Orai (Correspondence on Sights in Miyako (present-day Kyoto))," "Naniwa Orai (Letters On Sights of Naniwa (present-day Osaka))" and "Nakasendo Orai," and in the period of the Meiji Restoration, "Sekaifuzoku Orai" was composed.

Furthermore, oraimono featuring geography, scenery, and produce of other regions were written to interest children, which include "Nihonkunizukushi," "Miyakomeisho Orai" (Correspondence on Sights in Miyako (present-day Kyoto)), "Naniwa Orai" (Letters On Sights of Naniwa (present-day Osaka)) and "Nakasendo Orai," and in the period of the Meiji Restoration, "Sekaifuzoku Orai" was composed.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、クォーテーションの位置を移動
